content:
isaacvetter opened PR #296 from fix-broken-links to master:

Per Tony, but more completely from https://www.brokenlinkcheck.com/

From: Julian, Anthony J. <ajulian@mayo.edu>
Sent: Wednesday, November 6, 2019 3:59 PM
To: Jonathan Whitby <jwhitby@vitalimages.com>; Paul A. Knapp <pknapp@pknapp.com>; Isaac Vetter <Isaac@epic.com>
Cc: Christopher.lindop@ge.com; lorraine@constable.ca; Wayne Kubick (HL7) <wkubick@hl7.org>; Kreisler, Austin J. <AUSTIN.J.KREISLER@leidos.com>
Subject: RE: FHIRcast publication request, notes from Monday's TSC meeting

External Mail

Oh, and the ‘published’ content SHALL be on an HL7 managed website, e.g. fhircast.hl7.org, not on fhircast.org

Anthony (Tony) Julian FHL7,MQF|IT Technical Specialist II|EIA Platform|Information Technology|Phone: 507-293-8384|Fax: upon request|E-mail: ajulian@mayo.edu
Mayo Clinic | 200 First Street S.W. | Rochester, MN 55905 | www.mayoclinic.org

From: Julian, Anthony J.
Sent: Wednesday, November 06, 2019 3:42 PM
To: 'Jonathan Whitby'; Paul A. Knapp; Isaac Vetter
Cc: Christopher.lindop@ge.com; 'lorraine@constable.ca'
Subject: RE: FHIRcast publication request, notes from Monday's TSC meeting

Hi Jonathon:
Unless I am using the wrong copy:
I think some more QC is in order. Starting at http://fhircast.org/specification/STU1/ I found the following:

http://fhircast.org/specification/STU1/
“and the app is notified” - link to event-notification is broken

“The below flow diagram illustrates the series of interactions.” Flow diagram included in document, but the link goes to googledrive.
Ditto for flow diagram in Subscription Denial section
Link to RFC6151 in “The signature SHALL be computed using the HMAC algorithm (RFC6151) with ….” Goes to the websub specification reference to RFC6151, and not to RFC6151 itself. There are several more like this.

Event Notification Request Detail: link to event catalog in “ event in the Event Catalog defines” doesn’t seem to go anywhere.

In Section” Event Notification Errors” the link to Event Catalog in the first sentence goes to 404
In the section Event Definition Format the “ImagingStudy-open” event goes to a page outside of STU1.

http://fhircast.org/specification/STU1/#events
New events are proposed in a prescribed format using the documentation template – ( link to /specification/events/template) is broken

Event maturity model table first row maturity level 0 “Event is correctly named and defined” the named and defined hyperlinks don’t go anywhere.

At which point I gave up.

Anthony (Tony) Julian FHL7,MQF|IT Technical Specialist II|EIA Platform|Information Technology|Phone: 507-293-8384|Fax: upon request|E-mail: ajulian@mayo.edu
Mayo Clinic | 200 First Street S.W. | Rochester, MN 55905 | www.mayoclinic.org
isaacvetter requested lbergnehr for a review on PR #296.
isaacvetter requested lbergnehr, and wmaethner for a review on PR #296.
isaacvetter requested lbergnehr, wmaethner, and NiklasSvenzen for a review on PR #296.
